conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway/isometric-style model with visible wall height/thickness, multiple wall faces, and an elevated angled camera exposing interior volume.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear 3D extrusion and room volumes; angled view is correct; cutaway is present. Minor issues: some geometry looks simplified/soft at corners and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (living/dining left, kitchen/utility top, toilet central/top-right, bedroom right, balcony bottom-left). Some proportional/partition fidelity and opening placement are hard to confirm due to blur/simplification.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture is present (sofa, dining table, bed) and generally placed in correct rooms. Kitchen elements are simplified; bathroom fixtures/door details are not clearly readable.

visual_clarity.notes: Walls/floors are distinguishable, but the render is low-detail/blurred. Text labels appear inside the 3D model, reducing presentation cleanliness.

detected_errors.description: Text labels are visible inside the 3D render (e.g., room names/dimensions), contaminating presentation.
Door/window opening positions and sizes are not fully verifiable; some openings/doors are unclear or simplified compared to the 2D plan.
Low sharpness/simplified geometry reduces readability of partitions and fixtures.

summary: A genuine 3D cutaway conversion with largely faithful overall layout, but reduced clarity and simplified/unclear openings and fixtures limit strict geometric verification.
